sn2.14:4.1: Standing to one side, the god Nandana addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn2.14:5.1: “I ask you, Gotama, whose wisdom is vast,
sn2.14:5.2: the Blessed One of unhindered knowledge and vision.
sn2.14:5.3: What kind of person do they call ethical?
sn2.14:5.4: What kind of person do they call wise?
sn2.14:5.5: What kind of person who lives on after transcending suffering?
sn2.14:5.6: What kind of person is worshipped by the gods?”
sn2.14:6.1: “A person who is ethical, wise, self-developed,
sn2.14:6.2: converged in samādhi, loving jhāna, mindful,
sn2.14:6.3: who’s gotten rid of and given up all sorrows,
sn2.14:6.4: with defilements ended, they bear their final body.
sn2.14:7.1: That’s the kind of person they call ethical.
sn2.14:7.2: That’s the kind of person they call wise.
sn2.14:7.3: That kind of person lives on after transcending suffering.
sn2.14:7.4: That kind of person is worshiped by the gods.”
